network_overview: The capture contains pure IMS SIP signalling for two parallel VoLTE/VoNR call attempts that both fail: the first pair is cancelled by the subscriber after ~26 s, the second pair times-out after <1 s. All four INVITEs receive 407 Proxy Authentication Required, indicating missing or invalid IMS AKA credentials, and none reach an answered state.

observations.finding: 100 % of SIP INVITEs (8/8) rejected with 407; no 200 OK (INVITE) seen
Zero calls completed; no RTP flows present → effective voice service outage
Call set-up delay healthy (<1 s to 180 Ringing) when auth succeeds on re-INVITE
Early media (183 Session Progress) and ringing (180) arrived, showing bearer reserved

root_causes.description: Every initial INVITE is challenged with 407 Proxy Authentication Required and the subsequent INVITE carries no valid Security-Verify/Authorization headers, so the S-CSCF continues to reject. UE appears not to have run IMS AKA or the P-CSCF is not inserting proper credentials.
root_causes.impact: Complete prevention of VoLTE/VoNR call setup; subscribers cannot originate any voice/video call.
evidence_refs: Calls 1-4 all show 407 before any progress

root_causes.description: After authentication is bypassed on re-INVITE, calls stay in ringing state for ~25 s and are then CANCELled (cause 16) or time-out, indicating far-end no-answer or UE impatience rather than network failure.
root_causes.impact: Perceived call failure by end-user even when bearer is reserved; increases repeat attempts and signalling load.
evidence_refs: Call 3 ends with INVITE_SETUP_TIMEOUT after 0.9 s

recommendations.action: Check UE/USIM IMS AKA status: verify ISIM keys, SQN sync, and that P-CSCF address is correctly received in PCO/Protocol Configuration Options during EPS/5GS attach.
recommendations.rationale: Eliminates the 407 rejection root cause and allows normal IMS registration/calls.

recommendations.action: Collect simultaneous P-CSCF/S-CSCF logs and compare Security-Verify headers; if missing, update P-CSCF config to insert proper credentials after AKA.
recommendations.rationale: Ensures the second INVITE satisfies the 407 challenge.

recommendations.action: Review ringing timer (T301/T303) and MMTel AS configuration to reduce post-180 wait time and avoid user-abandoned calls.
recommendations.rationale: Lowers cancellation rate and improves user experience.

recommendations.action: Enable SIP capture on Mb interface to confirm RTP bearer establishment and check for any bearer-level (GTP-U/QoS) issues that could delay alerting.
recommendations.rationale: Validates that data-plane is not contributing to late alerting.

session_analysis.signaling_health: Control-plane is responsive (sub-second 100/183/180) but authentication layer is broken (100 % 407 on first INVITE).
session_analysis.user_plane_health: No RTP flows captured; however 183/180 indicate bearer was reserved, so user-plane likely set up but never used.
session_analysis.voice_quality: No answered calls → no MOS/RTP metrics; from signalling, bearer appeared ready so quality would have been normal if call completed.
session_analysis.cross_plane_correlation: SIP signalling shows successful QoS bearer activation (183 Session Progress) yet call is torn down before media starts; failure is purely signalling-layer (auth/answer) not transport.

sequence_diagram:
sequenceDiagram
    participant UE
    participant P-CSCF
    participant S-CSCF
    UE->>P-CSCF: INVITE (no auth)
    P-CSCF->>S-CSCF: INVITE
    S-CSCF-->>P-CSCF: 407 Proxy Authentication Required
    P-CSCF-->>UE: 407
    UE->>P-CSCF: ACK
    Note over UE,S-CSCF: UE re-submits INVITE but 407 repeats
    S-CSCF-->>UE: 180 Ringing
    Note over UE,S-CSCF: ~25 s wait
    UE->>S-CSCF: CANCEL (cause 16)
    S-CSCF-->>UE: 487 Request Terminated
    UE->>S-CSCF: ACK
